text:
East River, showing (left to right) piers 14 and 15, off South Street, at the foot of Maiden Lane and John Street, respectively. In the background appear (right) the Municipal Building and (center) the Woolworth Building.

June 12, 1925.

P. L. Sperr.
title: East River - Piers 14-15 - [Municipal Building ; Woolworth Building.]

text:
Burling Slip, at, adjoining and west of the N.W. corner of South Street. This view shows South Street, west side, north from Burling Slip, to and including Fulton Street.

January 8, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Burling Slip - South Street

text:
Pier No. 16, East River, at South Street. Shown is South Street, west side, south from and including Burling Slip, to Fletcher Street. Prominent buildings from left to right, are the Farmer's Loan and Trust Company, the Cities Service Company and the Bank of Manhattan.

September 22, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.
title: East River - Pier 16 - [Bank of Manhattan; Farmer's Loan and Trust Company.]

text:
Burling Slip, north side, west from (No. 31) but not including South, to Pearl Streets, and showing prominently a 10-story building (No. 21 Burling Slip and 182-184 Front Street) at the N.W. corner. Adjoining same, is a 5-story loft, No. 186 Front Street. Beyond Pearl Street, upon which is the South Ferry Division of the Second and Third Ave. Elevated Lines, this street becomes known as John Street.
January 31, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Burling Slip - South Street

text:
South Street, west side, north from Burling Slip, showing the buildings that constitute a portion of the Fulton Fish Market district. The market building pro- per is in the next block above. In the background is the Brooklyn Bridge.

D6 - NEG.# 3143
D7 - NEG# 3144
P. L. Sperr
D8 - NEG# 3145

1-2: May 2, 1933
3: Jan. 31, 1932

title: Manhattan: South Street - Burling Slip

text:
(1) South Street, west side, north from (No. 90), but not including Burling Slip, showing the Fulton Fish Market (2-story building in center of view), reputed to be the world's largest of its kind. Also shown, is a portion of the Brooklyn Bridge in the background.

January 31, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, at a later date.

May 2, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: South Street - Burling Slip

text:
(1) South Street, west side, north from (No. 90), but not including Burling Slip, showing the Fulton Fish Market (2-story building in center of view), reputed to be the world's largest of its kind. Also shown, is a portion of the Brooklyn Bridge in the background.

January 31, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, at a later date.

May 2, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: South Street - Burling Slip

text:
(1)
East River, south from John Street (right), showing the confluence of the East and North (Hudson) Rivers at Battery Park across which is visible (left background) the shore of Jersey City, New Jersey. Also shown is the skyline of Lower Manhattan. The vantage point is the Hotel St. George, Brooklyn.
June 15, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, south from Peck Slip (right). In the foreground are shown Brooklyn piers.
June 15, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: East River - Shore and skyline of lower Manhattan - South Ferry - Williamsburg Bridge - [Confluence of the East and North (Hudson) Rivers.]

text:
(1)
East River, south from John Street (right), showing the confluence of the East and North (Hudson) Rivers at Battery Park across which is visible (left background) the shore of Jersey City, New Jersey. Also shown is the skyline of Lower Manhattan. The vantage point is the Hotel St. George, Brooklyn.
June 15, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, south from Peck Slip (right). In the foreground are shown Brooklyn piers.
June 15, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: East River - Shore and skyline of lower Manhattan - South Ferry - Williamsburg Bridge - [Confluence of the East and North (Hudson) Rivers.]

text:
86 and 87 South Street, adjoining and at the S.W. corner of Burling Slip. Also shown, is No. 37 Burling Slip, west of the N.W. corner of South Street.

March 30, 1934.

P. L. Sperr,
title: Manhattan: South Street - Burling Slip

text:
Rope Store: Peerless Equipment Company
189 South Street, Manhattan

"Changing New York"
Berenice Abbott, photographer

title: Manhattan: South Street.
